div.p: The grace of Christ be with you. The messenger was in a great hurry to leave; hence it happened, esteemed patron and brother in Christ, that I was unable to write what I wanted. The prince is expected daily, I wish he would not change his customs and ceremonies, which he uses in the duchy,... bears. I have business with M.

Caspar Greter, the court preacher, who insists on revising our catechism to the form of Württemberg, about which, if I had time, I would say more. Privately, he wishes to impose upon us an examination before the meal and a greater explanation of the presence of Christ, etc., and I do not know what else. I have with me a booklet published by the Duke of Prussia on justification, about which Osiander and others have been raving for almost three years; if you do not have it, I would send it along with the Württemberg Confession. Farewell, farewell, and as you are accustomed, pray for me. Greet everyone. May 16, 1553.
To the distinguished man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, Antistes of the Church of Zürich, always to be esteemed as a brother in Christ.
